channel.title: IP problems
channel.description:
Okay, it seems like no matter what I change...My client will not auto connect to the ip I want it to. I have no EGui file...For those of you who say change that, and I've tried most everything else...Any help? I wouldn't need this for the fact that I'm turning it into a webclient.
Thanks in advance, Set

item.title: IP problems
item.dc:creator: @Umah Umah
item.description:
@Umah wrote:

Setsuna, do you have Team Viewer? Or, give me a copy of your client.java and gui.java, and I can check if anything was done wrong, add my msn if u have it. xx.mott.xx@live.com

Read full topic

item.title: IP problems
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Umah:

Idk if this will help or not, but… go into Gui.java, and Client.java, and search (Ctrl + F) for “.no-”, usually the i.ps are that, if not, search like “servequake” “sytes”, the standard free no-ip options.

Tried. Failed.

Read full topic

item.title: IP problems
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Setsuna:

I portforwarded. The client has a change IP option near the top which, after putting in my ip, will let me log on.

Read full topic

[quote=“Setsuna, post:3, topic:285192”]I portforwarded. The client has a change IP option near the top which, after putting in my ip, will let me log on.

But, like I said…Making it into a webclient…So it will not have that.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 24, 2009, 09:28:02 am[/size][hr]And I’ve been looking in Gui, not found anything that works…Any suggestions on what to look for?[/quote]Do You checked your no-ip duc? …
